description: Genetics examines relationships between genotype and phenotype in prokaryotic and eukaryotic
organisms from classical and molecular perspectives. Lectures cover ideas and technologies
contributing to understanding mechanisms of gene transmission and regulation.  Laboratories
utilize model organisms to investigate classical and molecular modes of inheritance.  Students
attend lectures plus one three-hour laboratory per week. Prerequisites: Biology 125 and one
semester of chemistry or concurrent registration, or Chemistry/Biology 125-127.  Offered both
